ok

Now let's focus on the methods 
rascal>myMethods = methods(myModel);
set[loc]: {
  |java+method:///HelloWorld/main(java.lang.String%5B%5D)|,
  |java+method:///ByeWorld/m()|,
  |java+method:///ByeWorld/l()|,
  |java+method:///ByeWorld/two()|,
  |java+method:///ByeWorld/k()|,
  |java+method:///ByeWorld/j()|,
  |java+method:///ByeWorld/main(java.lang.String%5B%5D)|,
  |java+method:///ByeWorld/i()|,
  |java+method:///HelloWorld/m()|,
  |java+method:///HelloWorld/two()|,
  |java+method:///ByeWorld/h()|,

  |java+method:///HelloWorld/k()|,
  |java+method:///ByeWorld/f()|,

}
What is the source code for a method? 
rascal>import IO;
ok
rascal>methodSrc = readFile(|java+method:///HelloWorld/main(java.lang.String%5B%5D)|);
str: "public static void main(String[] args) {\n\t\tSystem.out.println(one() + \" \" + two());\n\t\tint a = 1, b = 2;\n\t\t\n\t\tHelloWorld\<Integer\> x = new HelloWorld\<Integer\>();\n\t\tSystem.err.println(x.field);\n\t\t\n\t\tSystem.err.println(x.hashCode() + a + b);\n\t}"
let's print it: 
rascal>println(methodSrc)
public static void main(String[] args) {
		System.out.println(one() + " " + two());
		int a = 1, b = 2;
		
		HelloWorld<Integer> x = new HelloWorld<Integer>();
		System.err.println(x.field);
		
		System.err.println(x.hashCode() + a + b);
	}
ok
how many words in this method? 
rascal>(0 | it + 1 | /\W+/ := methodSrc)
int: 34

the size should be the same, right? 
rascal>import List;
ok
rascal>size([m@src | /Expression m := methodAST]) == (0 | it + 1 | /Expression _ := methodAST)
bool: true
